clinical_study.brief_title: Representation of the Body for Patients With Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Representation of the Body and Treatment of Peritoneal Cancer by Cytoreductive Surgery and Hyperthermic Intraperitoneal Chemotherapy (HIPEC) - A Collaborative Approach Between Professionals of Health / Patients / Researchers

primary_outcome.description: Comprehensive knowledge concerning the way the patients are living cancer event, treatment, changes in their body representations and conceptions of their lives. This qualitative study do not include outcome measures. Its purpose is restricted to the meanings

arm_group.description: Patients treated by HIPEC for peritoneal cancer
Patients treated by standard chemiotherapy for peritoneal cancer

intervention.description: Interviews will be done with patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients eligible to treatment of cancer by cytoreductive surgery and HIPEC
- Primary (pseudomyxoma, mesothelioma) and secondary (colorectal, gastric, ovarian) peritoneal cancer
- Free consent
- Male or Female
- Age > 18 years
- Affiliate to social security
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 years, no french speaking
- Cerebrals metastasis
- Psychiatrics diseases
